methods.chunkSize:
**Incompatible overloads text - text from the first overload:**

Return the size of chunk needed to process the shifts in this update update.

*Overload 1*  
  :param upstream: (io.deephaven.db.v2.ShiftAwareListener.Update) - the update to process
  :param chunkSize: (int) - the maximum chunk size (a maximum for our size)
  :return: (int) an appropriate maximum chunk size for this update
  
*Overload 2*  
  :param updateSize: (long) - the existing update size (a minimum for our size)
  :param shifted: (io.deephaven.db.v2.utils.IndexShiftData) - the shift to get the effective size for (clamped to chunkSize)
  :param chunkSize: (int) - the maximum chunk size (a maximum for our size)
  :return: (int) an appropriate maximum chunk size for this update

text:
Calculate the size of the chunks needed to process an update.

 The assumption is that the operation processes removed, modified, and added values sequentially (not concurrently);
 so the largest add/modified/removed index is all that is needed at one time.  The effective shifts size is also
 included in the required update size.
